<@UBE37B8JX>
Best way to get these answers is to call with gitr directly. Can the two of you prepare a one-pager with the pros and cons of both challenges by Monday afternoon?

First step, however, is getting a clear picture of the pros and cons of competing in gitr in general as <@U8AM0S37E> told you and <@UBE37B8JX> yesterday. Main questions are: how much time investment will it be in the various stages? Is a financial compensation part of the deal and when?
<@UBNQTDJ7R> for now,  we should do the initial application for both and see which one 'lands'.,

<@UBNQTDJ7R> from a market and network position the edtech one is much more interesting. Especially given the fact that the that it directly connects us to companies and institutions that are on our list of potential customers anyways.
<@UBE37B8JX> what do you think?
But in terms of time and effort, I'm still inclining towards the GSE challenge
We can offer a good value proposition regarding solutions for vocational, medium and higher education

<https://getinthering.co/challenges/fast-track-your-edtech-startup-by-the-support-of-the-universities-of-the-tu-delft-leiden-and-erasmus-rotterdam/> <@UBNQTDJ7R> <@UBE37B8JX> did you see this one already? Actually more interesting than the other one imho...
